text: The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom the word of the Lord came in the days of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came also in the days of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah until the end of the eleventh year of King Zedekiah son of Josiah of Judah, until the captivity of Jerusalem in the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the word of the Lord came to me saying,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God! Truly I do not know how to speak, for I am only a boy.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord said to me,
“Do not say, ‘I am only a boy,’
for you shall go to all to whom I send you,
and you shall speak whatever I command you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then the Lord put out his hand and touched my mouth, and the Lord said to me,
“Now I have put my words in your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, today I appoint you over nations and over kingdoms,
to pluck up and to pull down,
to destroy and to overthrow,
to build and to plant.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Jeremiah, what do you see?” And I said, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me, “You have seen well, for I am watching over my word to perform it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me a second time, saying, “What do you see?” And I said, “I see a boiling pot, tilted away from the north.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me: “Out of the north disaster shall break out on all the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now I am calling all the tribes of the kingdoms of the north, says the Lord, and they shall come, and all of them shall set their thrones at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, against all its surrounding walls and against all the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will utter my judgments against them for all their wickedness in forsaking me; they have made offerings to other gods and worshiped the works of their own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, gird up your loins; stand up and tell them everything that I command you. Do not break down before them, or I will break you before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I for my part have made you today a fortified city, an iron pillar, and a bronze wall against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests, and the people of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will fight against you, but they shall not prevail against you, for I am with you, says the Lord, to deliver you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go and proclaim in the hearing of Jerusalem, Thus says the Lord:
I remember the devotion of your youth,
    your love as a bride,
how you followed me in the wilderness,
    in a land not sown.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel was holy to the Lord,
    the first fruits of his harvest.
All who ate of it were held guilty;
    disaster came upon them,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the word of the Lord, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
What wrong did your ancestors find in me
    that they went far from me
and went after worthless things and became worthless themselves?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They did not say, “Where is the Lord,
    who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
who led us in the wilderness,
    in a land of deserts and pits,
in a land of drought and deep darkness,
    in a land that no one passes through,
    where no one lives?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I brought you into a plentiful land
    to eat its fruits and its good things.
But when you entered you defiled my land
    and made my heritage an abomination.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore once more I accuse you,
            says the Lord,
    and I accuse your children’s children.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Has a nation changed its gods,
    even though they are no gods?
But my people have changed their glory
    for something that does not profit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
for my people have committed two evils:
    they have forsaken me,
the fountain of living water,
    and dug out cisterns for themselves,
cracked cisterns
    that can hold no water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is Israel a slave? Is he a homeborn servant?
    Why then has he become plunder?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Moreover, the people of Memphis and Tahpanhes
    have broken the crown of your head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you not brought this upon yourself
    by forsaking the Lord your God,
    while he led you in the way?
speaker: Narrator

text:
What then do you gain by going to Egypt,
    to drink the waters of the Nile?
Or what do you gain by going to Assyria,
    to drink the waters of the Euphrates?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wickedness will punish you,
    and your faithlessness will convict you.
Know and see that it is evil and bitter
    for you to forsake the Lord your God;
    the fear of me is not in you,
            says the Lord God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For long ago you broke your yoke
    and burst your bonds,
    and you said, “I will not serve!”
On every high hill
    and under every green tree
    you sprawled and prostituted yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet I planted you as a choice vine
    from the purest stock.
How then did you turn degenerate
    and become a wild vine?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though you wash yourself with lye
    and use much soap,
    the stain of your guilt is still before me,
            says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
a wild ass at home in the wilderness
in her heat sniffing the wind!
    Who can restrain her lust?
None who seek her need weary themselves;
    in her month they will find her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your feet from going bare
    and your throat from thirst.
But you said, “It is no use,
    for I have loved strangers,
    and after them I will go.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a thief is shamed when caught,
    so the house of Israel shall be shamed:
they, their kings, their officials,
    their priests, and their prophets,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who say to a tree, “You are my father,”
    and to a stone, “You gave me birth.”
For they have turned their backs to me
    and not their faces.
But in the time of their trouble they say,
    “Come and save us!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But where are your gods
    that you made for yourself?
Let them come, if they can save you,
    in your time of trouble,
for you have as many gods
    as you have towns, O Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you complain against me?
    You have all rebelled against me,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In vain I have struck down your children;
    they accepted no correction.
Your own sword devoured your prophets
    like a ravening lion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you, O generation, behold the word of the Lord!
Have I been a wilderness to Israel
    or a land of thick darkness?
Why then do my people say, “We are free;
    we will come to you no more”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can a young woman forget her ornaments
    or a bride her attire?
Yet my people have forgotten me,
    days without number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How well you direct your course
    to seek lovers!
So that even to wicked women
    you have taught your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also on your skirts is found
    the lifeblood of the innocent poor,
though you did not catch them breaking in.
    Yet in spite of all these things
speaker: Narrator

text:
you say, “I am innocent;
    surely his anger has turned from me.”
Now I am bringing you to judgment
    for saying, “I have not sinned.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you go about so much
    to change your way?
You shall be put to shame by Egypt
    as you were put to shame by Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From there also you will come away
    with your hands on your head,
for the Lord has rejected those in whom you trust,
    and you will not prosper through them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If a man divorces his wife
    and she goes from him
and becomes another man’s wife,
    will he return to her?
Would not such a land be greatly polluted?
You have prostituted yourself with many lovers,
    and would you return to me?
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look up to the bare heights and see!
    Where have you not been lain with?
By the waysides you sat waiting for lovers,
    like a nomad in the wilderness.
You have polluted the land
    with your prostitutions and wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the showers have been withheld,
    and the spring rain has not come,
yet you have the forehead of a prostitute;
    you refuse to be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you not just now called to me,
    “My Father, you are the friend of my youth—
speaker: Narrator

text:
will he be angry forever,
    will he be indignant to the end?”
This is how you have spoken,
    but you have done all the evil that you could.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to me in the days of King Josiah: Have you seen what she did, that faithless one, Israel, how she went up on every high hill and under every green tree and prostituted herself there?
speaker: Narrator

text: And I thought, “After she has done all this she will return to me,” but she did not return, and her false sister Judah saw it.
speaker: Narrator

text: She saw that for all the adulteries of that faithless one, Israel, I had sent her away with a decree of divorce, yet her false sister Judah did not fear, but she also went and prostituted herself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because she took her prostitution so lightly, she polluted the land, committing adultery with stone and tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet for all this her false sister Judah did not return to me with her whole heart but only in pretense, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me: Faithless Israel has shown herself less guilty than false Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say:
Return, faithless Israel,
            says the Lord.
I will not look on you in anger,
    for I am merciful,
            says the Lord;
I will not be angry forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Only acknowledge your guilt,
    that you have rebelled against the Lord your God
and scattered your favors among strangers under every green tree
    and have not obeyed my voice,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, O faithless children,
            says the Lord,
    for I am your husband;
I will take you, one from a city and two from a family,
    and I will bring you to Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give you shepherds after my own heart who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you have multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, says the Lord, they shall no longer say, “The ark of the covenant of the Lord.” It shall not come to mind or be remembered or missed, nor shall another one be made.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jerusalem shall be called the throne of the Lord, and all nations shall gather to it, to the presence of the Lord in Jerusalem, and they shall no longer stubbornly follow their own evil will.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days the house of Judah shall join the house of Israel, and together they shall come from the land of the north to the land that I gave your ancestors for a heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I thought
    how I would set you among my children
and give you a pleasant land,
    the most beautiful heritage of all the nations.
And I thought you would call to me, “My Father,”
    and would not turn from following me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, as a faithless wife leaves her husband,
    so you have been faithless to me, O house of Israel,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A voice on the bare heights is heard,
    the plaintive weeping of Israel’s children,
because they have perverted their way;
    they have forgotten the Lord their God:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, O faithless children,
    I will heal your faithlessness.
“Here we come to you,
    for you are the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly the hills are a delusion,
    a tumult on the mountains.
Truly in the Lord our God
    is the salvation of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But from our youth the shameful thing has devoured all for which our ancestors had labored, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our dishonor cover us, for we have sinned against the Lord our God, we and our ancestors, from our youth even to this day, and we have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you return, O Israel,
            says the Lord,
    if you return to me,
if you remove your abominations from my presence
    and do not waver,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and if you swear, “As the Lord lives!”
    in truth, in justice, and in uprightness,
then nations shall be blessed by you,
    and by you they shall boast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord to the people of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
Break up your fallow ground,
    and do not sow among thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Circumcise yourselves to the Lord;
    remove the foreskin of your hearts,
    O people of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem,
or else my wrath will go forth like fire
    and burn with no one to quench it,
    because of the evil of your doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare in Judah, and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say:
Blow the trumpet through the land;
    shout aloud and say,
“Gather together, and let us go
    into the fortified cities!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Raise a standard toward Zion;
    flee for safety; do not delay,
for I am bringing evil from the north
    and a great destruction.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Because of this put on sackcloth,
    lament and wail:
“The fierce anger of the Lord
    has not turned away from us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day, says the Lord, courage shall fail the king and the officials; the priests shall be appalled and the prophets astounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God, how utterly you have deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘It shall be well with you,’ even while the sword is at the throat!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem: A hot wind comes from me out of the bare heights in the desert toward the daughter of my people, not to winnow or cleanse,
speaker: Narrator

text: a wind too strong for that. Now it is I who speak in judgment against them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look! He comes up like clouds,
    his chariots like the whirlwind;
his horses are swifter than eagles—
    woe to us, for we are ruined!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Jerusalem, wash your heart clean of wickedness
    so that you may be saved.
How long shall your evil schemes
    lodge within you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a voice declares from Dan
    and proclaims disaster from Mount Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell the nations, “Here they are!”
    Proclaim against Jerusalem,
“Besiegers come from a distant land;
    they shout against the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have closed in around her like watchers of a field
    because she has rebelled against me,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your ways and your doings
    have brought this upon you.
This is your doom; how bitter it is!
    It has reached your very heart.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Disaster overtakes disaster;
    the whole land is laid waste.
Suddenly my tents are destroyed,
    my curtains in a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long must I see the standard
    and hear the sound of the trumpet?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I looked on the earth, and it was complete chaos,
    and to the heavens, and they had no light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I looked on the mountains, and they were quaking,
    and all the hills moved to and fro.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I looked, and there was no one at all,
    and all the birds of the air had fled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I looked, and the fruitful land was a desert,
    and all its cities were laid in ruins
    before the Lord, before his fierce anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord: The whole land shall be a desolation, yet I will not make a full end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of this the earth shall mourn
    and the heavens above grow black,
for I have spoken; I have purposed;
    I have not relented, nor will I turn back.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And you, O desolate one,
what do you mean that you dress in crimson,
    that you deck yourself with ornaments of gold,
    that you enlarge your eyes with paint?
In vain you beautify yourself.
    Your lovers despise you;
    they seek your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I heard a cry as of a woman in labor,
    anguish as of one bringing forth her first child,
the cry of daughter Zion gasping for breath,
    stretching out her hands,
“Woe is me! I am fainting before killers!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Run to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem,
    look around and take note!
Search its squares and see
    if you can find one person
who acts justly
    and seeks truth—
so that I may pardon Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although they say, “As the Lord lives,”
    yet they swear falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do your eyes not look for truth?
You have struck them,
    but they felt no anguish;
you have consumed them,
    but they refused to take correction.
They have made their faces harder than rock;
    they have refused to turn back.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
How can I pardon you?
    Your children have forsaken me
    and have sworn by those who are no gods.
When I fed them to the full,
    they committed adultery
    and trooped to the houses of prostitutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They were well-fed lusty stallions,
    each neighing for his neighbor’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?
            says the Lord,
    and shall I not bring retribution
    on a nation such as this?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go up through her vine rows and destroy,
    but do not make a full end;
strip away her branches,
    for they are not the Lord’s.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah
    have been utterly faithless to me,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have spoken falsely of the Lord
    and have said, “He will do nothing.
No evil will come upon us,
    and we shall not see sword or famine.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The prophets are nothing but wind,
    for the word is not in them.
Thus shall it be done to them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord, the God of hosts:
Because you have spoken this word,
I am now making my words in your mouth a fire
    and this people wood, and the fire shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am going to bring upon you
    a nation from far away, O house of Israel,
            says the Lord.
It is an enduring nation;
    it is an ancient nation,
a nation whose language you do not know,
    nor can you understand what they say.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their quiver is like an open tomb;
    all of them are mighty warriors.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: But even in those days, says the Lord, I will not make a full end of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when your people say, “Why has the Lord our God done all these things to us?” you shall say to them, “As you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your land, so you shall serve strangers in a land that is not yours.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare this in the house of Jacob;
    proclaim it in Judah:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, O foolish and senseless people,
    who have eyes but do not see,
    who have ears but do not hear.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But this people has a stubborn and rebellious heart;
    they have turned aside and gone away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do not say in their hearts,
    “Let us fear the Lord our God,
who gives the rain in its season,
    the autumn rain and the spring rain,
and keeps for us
    the weeks appointed for the harvest.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your iniquities have turned these away,
    and your sins have deprived you of good.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
they have grown fat and sleek.
They know no limits in deeds of wickedness;
    they do not judge with justice
the cause of the orphan, to make it prosper,
    and they do not defend the rights of the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?
            says the Lord,
    and shall I not bring retribution

speaker: Narrator

text:
An appalling and horrible thing
    has happened in the land:
speaker: Narrator

text:
the prophets prophesy falsely,
    and the priests rule as the prophets direct;
my people love to have it so,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Flee for safety, O children of Benjamin,
    from the midst of Jerusalem!
Blow the trumpet in Tekoa,
    and raise a signal on Beth-haccherem,
for evil looms out of the north
    and great destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have likened daughter Zion
    to the loveliest pasture.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Up, and let us attack by night,

speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Take warning, O Jerusalem,
    or I shall turn from you in disgust
and make you a desolation,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
Glean thoroughly as a vine

like a grape gatherer, pass your hand again

speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their houses shall be turned over to others,

for I will stretch out my hand
    against the inhabitants of the land,

speaker: Narrator

text:
For from the least to the greatest of them,

speaker: Narrator

text:
They have treated the wound of my people carelessly,

Narrator

text:

text:
Therefore hear, O nations,

text:
Hear, O earth; I am going to bring disaster on this people,

because they have not given heed to my words,

text:
Of what use to me is frankincense that comes from Sheba

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
See, I am laying before this people

Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not go out into the field

for the enemy has a sword;

O daughter of my people, put on sackcloth

make mourning as for an only child,

for suddenly the destroyer

text:
I have made you a tester and a refiner among my people

Narrator
Narrator

text:

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand in the gate of the Lord’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of the Lord, all you people of Judah, you who enter these gates to worship the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Amend your ways and your doings, and let me dwell with you in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not trust in these deceptive words: “This is the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you truly amend your ways and your doings, if you truly act justly one with another,
speaker: Narrator

text: if you do not oppress the alien, the orphan, and the widow or shed innocent blood in this place, and if you do not go after other gods to your own hurt,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will dwell with you in this place, in the land that I gave to your ancestors forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here you are, trusting in deceptive words to no avail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, make offerings to Baal, and go after other gods that you have not known
speaker: Narrator

text: and then come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, “We are safe!”—only to go on doing all these abominations?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your sight? I, too, am watching, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go now to my place that was in Shiloh, where I made my name dwell at first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, because you have done all these things, says the Lord, and when I spoke to you persistently, you did not listen, and when I called you, you did not answer,

text: yet they did not listen to me or pay attention, but they stiffened their necks. They did worse than their ancestors did.

text:

text:

Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear the words of this covenant, and speak to the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

text: You shall say to them, Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Cursed be anyone who does not heed the words of this covenant,

text: which I commanded your ancestors when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the iron smelter, saying, ‘Listen to my voice, and do all that I command you. So shall you be my people, and I will be your God,

text: that I may perform the oath that I swore to your ancestors, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this day.’ ” Then I answered, “So be it, Lord.”

text: And the Lord said to me: Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: Hear the words of this covenant and do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I solemnly warned your ancestors when I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, warning them persistently, even to this day, saying, “Obey my voice.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but everyone walked in the stubbornness of an evil will. So I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to me: Conspiracy exists among the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have turned back to the iniquities of their ancestors of old, who refused to heed my words; they have gone after other gods to serve them; the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant that I made with their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thus says the Lord, assuredly I am going to bring disaster upon them that they cannot escape; though they cry out to me, I will not listen to them.

speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, do not pray for this people or lift up a cry or prayer on their behalf, for I will not listen when they call to me in the time of their trouble.

text: What right has my beloved in my house, when she has done vile deeds? Can vows and sacrificial flesh avert your doom? Can you then exult?

Narrator

Narrator

text: Thus said the Lord to me, “Go and buy yourself a linen loincloth and put it on your loins, but do not dip it in water.”

speaker: Narrator

text: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the Lord commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

because the ground is cracked.

text: The Lord said to me: Do not pray for the welfare of this people.

text: Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name though I did not send them and who say, ‘Sword and famine shall not come on this land’: By sword and famine those prophets shall be consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem, victims of famine and sword. There shall be no one to bury them—themselves, their wives, their sons, and their daughters—for I will pour out their wickedness upon them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall say to them this word:
Let my eyes run down with tears night and day,
    and let them not cease,
for the virgin daughter of my people is struck down with a crushing blow,
    with a very grievous wound.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I go out into the field,
    look—those killed by the sword!
And if I enter the city,
    look—those sick with famine!
For both prophet and priest ply their trade throughout the land
    and have no knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you completely rejected Judah?
    Does your heart loathe Zion?
Why have you struck us down
    so that there is no healing for us?
We look for peace but find no good,
    for a time of healing, but there is terror instead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We acknowledge our wickedness, O Lord,
    the iniquity of our ancestors,
    for we have sinned against you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Can any idols of the nations bring rain,
    or can the heavens give showers?
Is it not you, O Lord our God?
    We set our hope on you,
    for it is you who do all this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me: Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my heart would not turn toward this people. Send them out of my sight, and let them go!
speaker: Narrator

text:
And when they say to you, “Where shall we go?” you shall say to them: Thus says the Lord:
Those destined for pestilence, to pestilence,
    and those destined for the sword, to the sword;
those destined for famine, to famine,
    and those destined for captivity, to captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will appoint over them four kinds of destroyers, says the Lord: the sword to kill, the dogs to drag away, and the birds of the air and the wild animals of the earth to devour and destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what King Manasseh son of Hezekiah of Judah did in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem,
    or who will bemoan you?
Who will turn aside
    to ask about your welfare?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rejected me, says the Lord;
    you are going backward,
so I have stretched out my hand against you and destroyed you—
    I am weary of relenting.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: Woe is me, my mother, that you ever bore me, a man of strife and contention to the whole land! I have not lent, nor have I borrowed, yet all of them curse me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said: Surely I have intervened in your life for good; surely I have brought enemies upon you in a time of trouble and in a time of distress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can one break iron, iron from the north, and bronze?
speaker: Narrator

text: Your wealth and your treasures I will give as plunder, without price, for all your sins, throughout all your territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you do not know, for in my anger a fire is kindled that shall burn against you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your words were found, and I ate them,
    and your words became to me a joy
    and the delight of my heart,
for I am called by your name,
    O Lord, God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I did not sit in the company of merrymakers,
    nor did I rejoice;
under the weight of your hand I sat alone,
    for you had filled me with indignation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why is my pain unceasing,
    my wound incurable,
    refusing to be healed?
Truly, you are to me like a deceitful brook,
    like waters that fail.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
If you turn back, I will take you back,
    and you shall stand before me.
If you utter what is precious and not what is worthless,
    you shall serve as my mouth.
It is they who will turn to you,
    not you who will turn to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will make you to this people
    a fortified wall of bronze;
they will fight against you,
    but they shall not prevail over you,
for I am with you
    to save you and deliver you,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will deliver you out of the hand of the wicked
    and redeem you from the grasp of the ruthless.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came to me:
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not take a wife, nor shall you have sons or daughters in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord concerning the sons and daughters who are born in this place and concerning the mothers who bear them and the fathers who father them in this land:
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall die of deadly diseases. They shall not be lamented, nor shall they be buried; they shall become like dung on the surface of the ground. They shall perish by the sword and by famine, and their dead bodies shall become food for the birds of the air and for the wild animals of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord: Do not enter the house of mourning or go to lament or bemoan them, for I have taken away my peace from this people, says the Lord, my steadfast love and mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both great and small shall die in this land; they shall not be buried, and no one shall lament for them; there shall be no gashing, no shaving of the head for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one shall break bread for the mourner, to offer comfort for the dead, nor shall anyone give them the cup of consolation to drink for their fathers or their mothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to banish from this place, in your days and before your eyes, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you tell this people all these words, and they say to you, “Why has the Lord pronounced all this great evil against us? What is our iniquity? What is the sin that we have committed against the Lord our God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall say to them: It is because your ancestors have forsaken me, says the Lord, and have gone after other gods and have served and worshiped them and have forsaken me and have not kept my law,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because you have behaved worse than your ancestors, for here you are, every one of you, following your stubborn evil will, refusing to listen to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will hurl you out of this land into a land that neither you nor your ancestors have known, and there you shall serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, the days are surely coming, says the Lord, when it shall no longer be said, “As the Lord lives who brought the people of Israel up out of the land of Egypt,”
speaker: Narrator

text: but “As the Lord lives who brought the people of Israel up out of the land of the north and out of all the lands where he had driven them.” For I will bring them back to their own land that I gave to their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am now sending for many fishermen, says the Lord, and they shall catch them, and afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain and every hill and out of the clefts of the rocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my eyes are on all their ways; they are not hidden from my presence, nor is their iniquity concealed from my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will doubly repay their iniquity and their sin because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of their detestable idols and have filled my inheritance with their abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, my strength and my stronghold,
    my refuge in the day of trouble,
to you shall the nations come
    from the ends of the earth and say:
“Our ancestors have inherited nothing but lies,
    worthless things in which there is no profit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can mortals make for themselves gods?
    Such are no gods!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore I am surely going to teach them, this time I am going to teach them my power and my might, and they shall know that my name is the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sin of Judah is written with an iron pen; with a diamond point it is engraved on the tablet of their hearts and on the horns of their altars,
speaker: Narrator

text: while their children remember their altars and their sacred poles beside every green tree and on the high hills,
speaker: Narrator

text: on the mountains in the open country. Your wealth and all your treasures I will give for spoil as the price of your sin throughout all your territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: By your own act you shall lose the heritage that I gave you, and I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you do not know, for in my anger a fire is kindled that shall burn forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Cursed are those who trust in mere mortals
    and make mere flesh their strength,
    whose hearts turn away from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be like a shrub in the desert
    and shall not see when relief comes.
They shall live in the parched places of the wilderness,
    in an uninhabited salt land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who trust in the Lord,
    whose trust is the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be like a tree planted by water,
    sending out its roots by the stream.
It shall not fear when heat comes,
    and its leaves shall stay green;
in the year of drought it is not anxious,
    and it does not cease to bear fruit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I the Lord test the mind
    and search the heart,
to give to all according to their ways,
    according to the fruit of their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like the partridge hatching what it did not lay,
    so are all who amass wealth unjustly;
in midlife it will leave them,
    and at their end they will prove to be fools.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O glorious throne, exalted from the beginning,
    shrine of our sanctuary!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O hope of Israel! O Lord!
    All who forsake you shall be put to shame;
those who turn away from you shall be recorded in the underworld,
    for they have forsaken the fountain of living water, the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
See how they say to me,
    “Where is the word of the Lord?
    Let it come!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I have not run away from being a shepherd in your service,
    nor have I desired the fatal day.
You know what came from my lips;
    it was before your face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not become a terror to me;
    you are my refuge in the day of disaster;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Thus said the Lord to me: Go and stand in the People’s Gate, by which the kings of Judah enter and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say to them: Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem who enter by these gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord: For the sake of your lives, take care that you do not bear a burden on the Sabbath day or bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And do not carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath or do any work, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they did not listen or incline their ear; they stiffened their necks and would not hear or receive instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you listen to me, says the Lord, and bring in no burden by the gates of this city on the Sabbath day but keep the Sabbath day holy and do no work on it,
speaker: Narrator

text: then there shall enter by the gates of this city kings who sit on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their officials, the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and this city shall be inhabited forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And people shall come from the towns of Judah and the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the Shephelah, from the hill country, and from the Negeb, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and frankincense, and bringing thank offerings to the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not listen to me, to keep the Sabbath day holy and to carry in no burden through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates; it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem and shall not be quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come, go down to the potter’s house, and there I will let you hear my words.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I went down to the potter’s house, and there he was working at his wheel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The vessel he was making of clay was spoiled in the potter’s hand, and he reworked it into another vessel, as seemed good to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Can I not do with you, O house of Israel, just as this potter has done? says the Lord. Just like the clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in my hand, O house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: At one moment I may declare concerning a nation or a kingdom that I will pluck up and break down and destroy it,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turns from its evil, I will change my mind about the disaster that I intended to bring on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at another moment I may declare concerning a nation or a kingdom that I will build and plant it,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if it does evil in my sight, not listening to my voice, then I will change my mind about the good that I had intended to do to it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, say to the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus says the Lord: Look, I am a potter shaping evil against you and devising a plan against you. Turn now, all of you, from your evil way, and amend your ways and your doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they say, “It is no use! We will follow our own plans, and each of us will act according to the stubbornness of our evil will.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
Ask among the nations:
    Who has heard the like of this?
The virgin Israel has done
    a most horrible thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does the snow of Lebanon leave
    the crags of Sirion?
Do the mountain waters run dry,
    the cold flowing streams?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
making their land a horror,
    a thing to be hissed at forever.
All who pass by it are horrified
    and shake their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like the wind from the east,
    I will scatter them before the enemy.
I will show them my back, not my face,
    in the day of their calamity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said, “Come, let us make plots against Jeremiah, for instruction shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, let us bring charges against him, and let us not heed any of his words.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give heed to me, O Lord,
    and listen to what my adversaries say!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is evil a recompense for good?
    Yet they have dug a pit for my life.
Remember how I stood before you
    to speak good for them,
    to turn away your wrath from them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
May a cry be heard from their houses
    when you bring the marauder suddenly upon them!
For they have dug a pit to catch me
    and laid snares for my feet.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Thus said the Lord: Go and buy a potter’s earthenware jug. Take with you some of the elders of the people and some of the senior priests,
speaker: Narrator

text: and go out to the valley of the son of Hinnom at the entry of the Potsherd Gate, and proclaim there the words that I tell you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say: Hear the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring such disaster upon this place that the ears of everyone who hears of it will tingle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the people have forsaken me and have profaned this place by making offerings in it to other gods whom neither they nor their ancestors nor the kings of Judah have known, and because they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent
speaker: Narrator

text: and gone on building the high places of Baal to burn their children in the fire as burnt offerings to Baal, which I did not command or decree, nor did it enter my mind,
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore the days are surely coming, says the Lord, when this place shall no more be called Topheth or the valley of the son of Hinnom but the valley of Slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this place I will make void the plans of Judah and Jerusalem and will make them fall by the sword before their enemies and by the hand of those who seek their life. I will give their dead bodies for food to the birds of the air and to the wild animals of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make this city a horror, a thing to be hissed at; everyone who passes by it will be horrified and will hiss because of all its disasters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and all shall eat the flesh of their neighbors in the siege and in the distress with which their enemies and those who seek their life afflict them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall break the jug in the sight of those who go with you
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall say to them: Thus says the Lord of hosts: So will I break this people and this city as one breaks a potter’s vessel, so that it can never be mended. In Topheth they shall bury until there is no more room to bury.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus will I do to this place, says the Lord, and to its inhabitants, making this city like Topheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be defiled like the place of Topheth—all the houses upon whose roofs offerings have been made to the whole host of heaven and libations have been poured out to other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy, he stood in the court of the Lord’s house and said to all the people:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I am now bringing upon this city and upon all its towns all the disaster that I have pronounced against it, because they have stiffened their necks, refusing to hear my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the priest Pashhur son of Immer, who was chief officer in the house of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pashhur struck the prophet Jeremiah and put him in the stocks that were in the upper Benjamin Gate of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next morning when Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord has named you not Pashhur but ‘Terror-all-around.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord: I am making you a terror to yourself and to all your friends, and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies while you look on. And I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon; he shall carry them captive to Babylon and shall kill them with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give all the wealth of this city, all its gains, all its prized belongings, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hand of their enemies, who shall plunder them and seize them and carry them to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, shall go into captivity, and to Babylon you shall go; there you shall die, and there you shall be buried, you and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied falsely.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For whenever I speak, I must cry out;
    I must shout, “Violence and destruction!”
For the word of the Lord has become for me
    a reproach and derision all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I say, “I will not mention him
    or speak any more in his name,”
then within me there is something like a burning fire
    shut up in my bones;
I am weary with holding it in,
    and I cannot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I hear many whispering:
    “Terror is all around!
Denounce him! Let us denounce him!”
    All my close friends
    are watching for me to stumble.
“Perhaps he can be enticed,
    and we can prevail against him
    and take our revenge on him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord is with me like a terrifying warrior;
    therefore my persecutors will stumble,
    and they will not prevail.
They will be greatly shamed,
    for they will not succeed.
Their eternal dishonor
    will never be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord;
    praise the Lord!
For he has delivered the life of the needy
    from the hands of evildoers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cursed be the day
    on which I was born!
The day when my mother bore me,
    let it not be blessed!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cursed be the man
    who brought the news to my father, saying,
“A child is born to you, a son,”
    making him very glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let that man be like the cities
    that the Lord overthrew without pity;
let him hear a cry in the morning
    and an alarm at noon,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why did I come forth from the womb
    to see toil and sorrow
    and spend my days in shame?
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchiah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Please inquire of the Lord on our behalf, for King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon is making war against us; perhaps the Lord will perform a wonderful deed for us, as he has often done, and Nebuchadrezzar will withdraw.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeremiah said to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall say to Zedekiah: Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: I am going to turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands and with which you are fighting against the king of Babylon and against the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside the walls, and I will bring them together into the center of this city.
speaker: Narrator

text: I myself will fight against you with outstretched hand and mighty arm, in anger, in fury, and in great wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will strike down the inhabitants of this city, both humans and animals; they shall die of a great pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward, says the Lord, I will give King Zedekiah of Judah and his servants and the people in this city—those who survive the pestilence, sword, and famine—into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their lives. He shall strike them down with the edge of the sword; he shall not pity them or spare them or have compassion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to this people you shall say: Thus says the Lord: See, I am setting before you the way of life and the way of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who stay in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence, but those who go out and surrender to the Chaldeans who are besieging you shall live and shall have their lives as a prize of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have set my face against this city for evil and not for good, says the Lord; it shall be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the house of the king of Judah say: Hear the word of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O house of David! Thus says the Lord:
Execute justice in the morning,
    and deliver from the hand of the oppressor
    anyone who has been robbed,
or else my wrath will go forth like fire
    and burn, with no one to quench it,
    because of their evil doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley,
    O rock of the plain,
            says the Lord;
you who say, “Who can come down against us,
    or who can enter our places of refuge?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings,
            says the Lord;
    I will kindle a fire in its forest,
    and it shall devour all that is around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord: Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say: Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah sitting on the throne of David—you, and your servants, and your people who enter these gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord: Act with justice and righteousness and deliver from the hand of the oppressor anyone who has been robbed. And do no wrong or violence to the alien, the orphan, and the widow, or shed innocent blood in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you will indeed obey this word, then through the gates of this house shall enter kings who sit on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses—they, their servants, and their people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you will not heed these words, I swear by myself, says the Lord, that this house shall become a desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord concerning the house of the king of Judah:
You are like Gilead to me,
    like the summit of Lebanon,
but I swear that I will make you a desert,
    uninhabited cities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will prepare destroyers against you,
    all with their weapons;
they shall cut down your choicest cedars
    and cast them into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many nations will pass by this city, and all of them will say one to another, “Why has the Lord dealt in this way with that great city?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will answer, “Because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord their God and worshiped other gods and served them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not weep for him who is dead,
    nor bemoan him;
weep rather for him who goes away,
    for he shall return no more
    to see his native land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord concerning Shallum son of King Josiah of Judah, who succeeded his father Josiah and who went away from this place: He shall return here no more,
speaker: Narrator

text: but in the place where they have carried him captive he shall die, and he shall never see this land again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness
    and his upper rooms by injustice,
who makes his neighbors work for nothing
    and does not give them their wages,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who says, “I will build myself a spacious house
    with large upper rooms,”
and who cuts out windows for it,
    paneling it with cedar
    and painting it with vermilion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are you a king
    because you compete in cedar?
Did not your father eat and drink
    and do justice and righteousness?
    Then it was well with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He judged the cause of the poor and needy;
    then it was well.
Is not this to know me?
    says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But your eyes and heart
    are only on your dishonest gain,
for shedding innocent blood,
    and for practicing oppression and violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord concerning King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:
They shall not lament for him, saying,
    “Alas, my brother!” or “Alas, sister!”
They shall not lament for him, saying,
    “Alas, lord!” or “Alas, his majesty!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the burial of a donkey he shall be buried:
    dragged off and thrown out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go up to Lebanon and cry out,
    and lift up your voice in Bashan;
cry out from Abarim,
    for all your lovers are crushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I spoke to you in your prosperity,
    but you said, “I will not listen.”
This has been your way from your youth,
    for you have not obeyed my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wind shall shepherd all your shepherds,
    and your lovers shall go into captivity;
then you will be ashamed and dismayed
    because of all your wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O inhabitant of Lebanon,
    nested among the cedars,
how you will groan when pangs come upon you,
    pain as of a woman in labor!
speaker: Narrator

text: As I live, says the Lord, even if King Coniah son of Jehoiakim of Judah were the signet ring on my right hand, even from there I would tear you off
speaker: Narrator

text: and give you into the hands of those who seek your life, into the hands of those whom you fear, even into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will hurl you and the mother who bore you into another country, where you were not born, and there you shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shall not return to the land to which they long to return.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is this man Coniah a despised broken pot,
    a vessel no one wants?
Why are he and his offspring hurled out
    and cast away in a land that they do not know?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O land, land, land,
    hear the word of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Record this man as childless,
    a man who shall not succeed in his days,
for none of his offspring shall succeed
    in sitting on the throne of David
    and ruling again in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning the shepherds who shepherd my people: It is you who have scattered my flock and have driven them away, and you have not attended to them. So I will attend to you for your evil doings, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I myself will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the lands where I have driven them, and I will bring them back to their fold, and they shall be fruitful and multiply.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will raise up shepherds over them who will shepherd them, and they shall no longer fear or be dismayed, nor shall any be missing, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days are surely coming, says the Lord, when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days Judah will be saved, and Israel will live in safety. And this is the name by which he will be called: “The Lord is our righteousness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the days are surely coming, says the Lord, when it shall no longer be said, “As the Lord lives who brought the people of Israel up out of the land of Egypt,”
speaker: Narrator

text: but “As the Lord lives who brought out and led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the land of the north and out of all the lands where he had driven them.” Then they shall live in their own land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning the prophets:
My heart is crushed within me;
    all my bones shake;
I have become like a drunkard,
    like one overcome by wine,
because of the Lord
    and because of his holy words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the land is full of adulterers;
    because of the curse the land mourns,
    and the pastures of the wilderness are dried up.
Their course has been evil,
    and their might is not right.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore their way shall be to them
    like slippery paths in the darkness,
    into which they shall be driven and fall,
for I will bring disaster upon them
    in the year of their punishment,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the prophets of Samaria
    I saw a disgusting thing:
they prophesied by Baal
    and led my people Israel astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But in the prophets of Jerusalem
    I have seen a more shocking thing:
they commit adultery and walk in lies;
    they strengthen the hands of evildoers,
    so that no one turns from wickedness;
all of them have become like Sodom to me
    and its inhabitants like Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the prophets:
I am going to make them eat wormwood
    and give them poisoned water to drink,
for from the prophets of Jerusalem
    ungodliness has spread throughout the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you; they are deluding you. They speak visions of their own minds, not from the mouth of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They keep saying to those who despise the word of the Lord, “It shall be well with you,” and to all who stubbornly follow their own stubborn hearts, they say, “No calamity shall come upon you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For who has stood in the council of the Lord
    so as to see and to hear his word?
    Who has given heed to his word so as to proclaim it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, the storm of the Lord!
    Wrath has gone forth,
a whirling tempest;
    it will burst upon the head of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The anger of the Lord will not turn back
    until he has executed and accomplished
    the intents of his mind.
In the latter days you will understand it clearly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I did not send the prophets,
    yet they ran;
I did not speak to them,
    yet they prophesied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But if they had stood in my council,
    then they would have proclaimed my words to my people,
and they would have turned them from their evil way
    and from the evil of their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Am I a God near by, says the Lord, and not a God far off?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can hide in secret places so that I cannot see them? says the Lord. Do I not fill heaven and earth? says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy lies in my name, saying, “I have dreamed! I have dreamed!”
speaker: Narrator

text: How long? Will the hearts of the prophets ever turn back—those who prophesy lies and who prophesy the deceit of their own heart?
speaker: Narrator

text: They plan to make my people forget my name by their dreams that they tell one another, just as their ancestors forgot my name for Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the prophet who has a dream tell the dream, but let the one who has my word speak my word faithfully. What has straw in common with wheat? says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not my word like fire, says the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?
speaker: Narrator

text: See, therefore, I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who steal my words from one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who use their own tongues and say, “Says the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams, says the Lord, and who tell them and who lead my people astray by their lies and their recklessness, when I did not send them or command them, so they do not profit this people at all, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When this people or a prophet or a priest asks you, “What is the burden of the Lord?” you shall say to them, “You are the burden. I will cast you off, says the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the prophet, priest, or the people who say, “The burden of the Lord,” I will punish them and their households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall you say to one another, among yourselves, “What has the Lord answered?” or “What has the Lord spoken?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But “the burden of the Lord” you shall mention no more, for the burden is everyone’s own word, and so you pervert the words of the living God, the Lord of hosts, our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall ask the prophet, “What has the Lord answered you?” or “What has the Lord spoken?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you say, “the burden of the Lord,” thus says the Lord: Because you have said these words, “the burden of the Lord,” when I sent to you, saying, “You shall not say, ‘the burden of the Lord,’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, I will surely lift you up and cast you away from my presence, you and the city that I gave to you and your ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring upon you everlasting disgrace and perpetual shame that shall not be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord showed me two baskets of figs placed before the temple of the Lord. This was after King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon had taken into exile from Jerusalem King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, together with the officials of Judah, the artisans, and the smiths, and had brought them to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: One basket had very good figs, like first-ripe figs, but the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I said, “Figs—the good figs very good and the bad figs very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Like these good figs, so I will regard as good the exiles from Judah whom I have sent away from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set my eyes upon them for good, and I will bring them back to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down; I will plant them and not pluck them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give them a heart to know that I am the Lord, and they will be my people, and I will be their God, for they will return to me with their whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thus says the Lord: Like the bad figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten, so will I treat King Zedekiah of Judah, his officials, the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and those who live in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make them a horror, an evil thing, to all the kingdoms of the earth—a disgrace, a byword, a taunt, and a curse in all the places where I shall drive them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send sword, famine, and pestilence upon them until they are utterly destroyed from the land that I gave to them and their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah (that was the first year of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon),
speaker: Narrator

text: which the prophet Jeremiah spoke to all the people of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
speaker: Narrator

text: For twenty-three years, from the thirteenth year of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah to this day, the word of the Lord has come to me, and I have spoken persistently to you, but you have not listened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And though the Lord persistently sent you all his servants the prophets, you have neither listened nor inclined your ears to hear
speaker: Narrator

text: when they said, “Turn now, every one of you, from your evil way and wicked doings, and you will remain on the land that the Lord has given to you and your ancestors from of old and forever;
speaker: Narrator

text: do not go after other gods to serve and worship them, and do not provoke me to anger with the work of your hands. Then I will do you no harm.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you did not listen to me, says the Lord, and so you have provoked me to anger with the work of your hands to your own harm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts: Because you have not obeyed my words,
speaker: Narrator

text: I am going to send for all the tribes of the north, says the Lord, even for King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, my servant, and I will bring them against this land and its inhabitants and against all these nations around; I will utterly destroy them and make them an object of horror and of hissing and an everlasting disgrace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will banish from them the sound of mirth and the sound of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones and the light of the lamp.
speaker: Narrator

text: This whole land shall become a ruin and a waste, and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after seventy years are completed, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans, for their iniquity, says the Lord, making the land an everlasting waste.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring upon that land all the words that I have uttered against it, everything written in this book that Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many nations and great kings shall make slaves of them also, and I will repay them according to their deeds and the work of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus the Lord, the God of Israel, said to me: Take from my hand this cup of the wine of wrath, and make all the nations to whom I send you drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall drink and stagger and go out of their minds because of the sword that I am sending among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took the cup from the Lord’s hand and made all the nations to whom the Lord sent me drink it:
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem and the towns of Judah, its kings and officials, to make them a desolation and a waste, an object of hissing and of cursing, as they are today;
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his officials, and all his people;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the mixed people; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of the land of the Philistines—Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;
speaker: Narrator

text: Edom, Moab, and the Ammonites;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the coastland across the sea;
speaker: Narrator

text: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who have shaved temples;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed peoples that live in the desert;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of Media;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the kings of the north, far and near, one after another, and all the kingdoms of the world that are on the face of the earth. And after them the king of Sheshach shall drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall say to them, Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Drink; get drunk and vomit; fall and rise no more because of the sword that I am sending among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if they refuse to accept the cup from your hand to drink, then you shall say to them: Thus says the Lord of hosts: You must drink!
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I am beginning to bring disaster on the city that is called by my name, and how can you possibly avoid punishment? You shall not go unpunished, for I am summoning a sword against all the inhabitants of the earth, says the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, therefore, shall prophesy to them all these words and say to them:
The Lord will roar from on high
    and from his holy habitation utter his voice;
he will roar mightily against his fold
    and shout like those who tread grapes
    against all the inhabitants of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The clamor will resound to the ends of the earth,
    for the Lord has an indictment against the nations;
he is entering into judgment with all flesh,
    and the guilty he will put to the sword,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
See, disaster is spreading
    from nation to nation,
and a great tempest is stirring
    from the farthest parts of the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Those slain by the Lord on that day shall extend from one end of the earth to the other. They shall not be lamented or gathered or buried; they shall become dung on the surface of the ground.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Flight shall fail the shepherds,
    and there shall be no escape for the lords of the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen! The cry of the shepherds
    and the wail of the lords of the flock!
For the Lord is despoiling their pasture,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and the peaceful folds are devastated
    because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a lion he has left his den,
    for their land has become a waste
because of the cruel anger
    and because of his fierce anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came from the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord: Stand in the court of the Lord’s house and speak to all the cities of Judah that come to worship in the house of the Lord; speak to them all the words that I command you; do not hold back a word.
speaker: Narrator

text: It may be that they will listen and will turn from their evil way, that I may change my mind about the disaster that I intend to bring on them because of their evil doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say to them: Thus says the Lord: If you will not listen to me, to walk in my law that I have set before you
speaker: Narrator

text: and to heed the words of my servants the prophets whom I send to you urgently—though you have not heeded—
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and I will make this city a curse for all the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jeremiah had finished speaking all that the Lord had commanded him to speak to all the people, then the priests and the prophets and all the people laid hold of him, saying, “You shall die!
speaker: Narrator

text: Why have you prophesied in the name of the Lord, saying, ‘This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate, without inhabitant’?” And all the people gathered around Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the officials of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the house of the Lord and took their seat in the entry of the New Gate of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priests and the prophets said to the officials and to all the people, “This man deserves the sentence of death because he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your own ears.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the officials and all the people, saying, “It is the Lord who sent me to prophesy against this house and this city all the words you have heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the Lord your God, and the Lord will change his mind about the disaster that he has pronounced against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, here I am in your hands. Do with me as seems good and right to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only know for certain that if you put me to death, you will be bringing innocent blood upon yourselves and upon this city and its inhabitants, for in truth the Lord sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, “This man does not deserve the sentence of death, for he has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the elders of the land arose and said to all the assembled people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Micah of Moresheth, who prophesied during the days of King Hezekiah of Judah, said to all the people of Judah: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts,
Zion shall be plowed as a field;
    Jerusalem shall become a heap of ruins
    and the mountain of the house a wooded height.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Did King Hezekiah of Judah and all Judah actually put him to death? Did he not fear the Lord and entreat the favor of the Lord, and did not the Lord change his mind about the disaster that he had pronounced against them? But we are about to bring great disaster on ourselves!”
speaker: Narrator

text: There was another man prophesying in the name of the Lord, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim. He prophesied against this city and against this land in words exactly like those of Jeremiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when King Jehoiakim, with all his warriors and all the officials, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death, but when Uriah heard of it, he was afraid and fled and escaped to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Jehoiakim sent Elnathan son of Achbor and men with him to Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they took Uriah from Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim, who struck him down with the sword and threw his dead body into the burial place of the common people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the hand of Ahikam son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah so that he was not given over into the hands of the people to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah son of Josiah of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord said to me: Make for yourself yoke straps and bars and put them on your neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon by the hand of the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to King Zedekiah of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give them this charge for their masters: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: This is what you shall say to your masters:
speaker: Narrator

text: It is I who by my great power and my outstretched arm have made the earth, with the people and animals that are on the earth, and I give it to whomever I please.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I have given all these lands into the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, my servant, and I have given him even the wild animals of the field to serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nations shall serve him and his son and his grandson, until the time of his own land comes; then many nations and great kings shall make him their slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any nation or kingdom will not serve this king, Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, and put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, then I will punish that nation with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence, says the Lord, until I have completed its destruction by his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: You, therefore, must not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your dreamers, your soothsayers, or your sorcerers, who are saying to you, “You shall not serve the king of Babylon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are prophesying a lie to you, with the result that you will be removed far from your land; I will drive you out, and you will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: But any nation that will bring its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will leave on its own land, says the Lord, to till it and to live there.
speaker: Narrator
